member.name: IDvdControl2.AcceptParentalLevelChange

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The AcceptParentalLevelChange method accepts or rejects a request from the DVD Navigator to play content at a higher parental management level.

member.param: Flag that indicates whether the application accepts the parental management level change. Specify TRUE to accept the change and play the higher-level content, or FALSE to reject the change.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error code otherwise.

member.name: IDvdControl2.ActivateAtPosition

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The ActivateAtPosition method activates the menu button under the mouse pointer position.

member.param: Point on the client window area, in screen pixel coordinates.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The click occurred in the highlighted button rectangle, and the button was successfully activated.
The point lies outside the valid video region.
The button is present but is not working.
The DVD Navigator is not in a menu domain.
There is no menu button under the mouse pointer position.
The operation is inhibited by user operation (UOP) control.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The ActivateButton method activates the currently selected menu button.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is in an invalid domain.
UOP control prohibits the DVD Navigator from entering a paused state.

member.name: IDvdControl2.Pause
member.summary:
[The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
Note This method is deprecated. Applications should call instead. For more information, see Data Flow in the DVD Navigator.The Pause method pauses or resumes playback at the current location.
member.param: Value of type Boolean that specifies whether to pause playback; TRUE means to pause.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: UOP control prohibits the DVD Navigator from entering a paused state.

member.name: IDvdControl2.PlayAtTime

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The PlayAtTime method starts playback from the specified time in the current title.

member.param: Pointer to a structure that specifies the time at which to start playback.
Bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration, specifying how to synchronize the command.
Receives a pointer to an object that can be used to synchronize DVD commands. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Synchronizing DVD Commands.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

member.name: IDvdControl2.PlayAtTimeInTitle

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The PlayAtTimeInTitle method starts playback from the specified time in the specified title.

member.param: Value that specifies the number of the title to play; this value must be from 1 through 99.
Pointer to a structure that specifies where playback will begin.
Bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration, specifying how to synchronize the command.
Receives a pointer to an object that can be used to synchronize DVD commands. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Synchronizing DVD Commands.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

member.name: IDvdControl2.PlayBackwards

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The PlayBackwards method plays backward at the specified speed from the current location.

member.param: Value that specifies the speed of backward play. This value is a multiplier, where 1.0 is the authored speed. So, a value of 2.5 plays backward at two and one-half times the authored speed, while a value of 0.5 plays backward at half the authored speed. The actual speed of playback depends on the video decoder's capabilities and might differ from the specified rate. For reverse play, audio is muted and no subpicture is displayed. Any speed below 0.00001 is converted to 0.00001.
Bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration, specifying how to synchronize the command.
Receives a pointer to an object that can be used to synchronize DVD commands. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Synchronizing DVD Commands.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

member.name: IDvdControl2.PlayChapter

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The PlayChapter method starts playback from the specified chapter in the current title.

member.param: Value that specifies the chapter in the current title where the DVD Navigator will start playback; this value must be from 1 through 999.
Bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration, specifying how to synchronize the command.
Receives a pointer to an object that can be used to synchronize DVD commands. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Synchronizing DVD Commands.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

member.name: IDvdControl2.PlayChapterInTitle

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The PlayChapterInTitle method starts playback from the beginning of the specified chapter of the specified title.

member.param: Value that specifies the title in which the chapter is located; this value must be from 1 through 99.
Value that specifies the chapter in the specified title where the DVD Navigator will start playback; this value must be from 1 through 999.
Bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration, specifying how to synchronize the command.
Receives a pointer to an object that can be used to synchronize DVD commands. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Synchronizing DVD Commands.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

member.name: IDvdControl2.PlayChaptersAutoStop

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The PlayChaptersAutoStop method plays the number of chapters specified, starting at the specified chapter within the specified title.

member.param: Value that specifies the title in which the chapter is located; this value must be from 1 through 99.
Value that specifies the chapter in the specified title where the DVD Navigator will start playback; this value must be from 1 through 999.
Number of chapters to play from the start chapter.
Bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration, specifying how to synchronize the command.
Receives a pointer to an object that can be used to synchronize DVD commands. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Synchronizing DVD Commands.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not initialized or the title is not a One Sequential PGC Title.

The ulTitle value does not exist or is greater than the number of titles, or ulChapter does not exist or is greater than the number of chapters, or ulChapter plus ulChaptersToPlay is greater than the number of chapters.
The graph is not in a running state.

member.name: IDvdControl2.PlayForwards

Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The PlayForwards method plays forward at the specified speed from the current location.

member.param: Value that specifies the playback speed. This value is a multiplier, where 1.0 is the authored speed, so a value of 2.5 plays at two and one-half times the authored speed, while a value of 0.5 plays at half the authored speed. The actual speed of playback depends on the capabilities of the video decoder. Values below 0.00001 are converted to 0.00001.
Bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration, specifying how to synchronize the command.
Receives a pointer to an object that can be used to synchronize DVD commands. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Synchronizing DVD Commands.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

Receives a pointer to an object that can be used to synchronize DVD commands. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Synchronizing DVD Commands.

The PlayPeriodInTitleAutoStop method starts playback in the specified title from the specified start time until the specified end time.

Pointer to a structure that specifies the time at which to start playing.
Pointer to a structure that specifies the time at which to stop playing.
Bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration, specifying how to synchronize the command.
Receives a pointer to an object that can be used to synchronize DVD commands. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Synchronizing DVD Commands.

Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

member.param: Bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration, specifying how to synchronize the command.
Receives a pointer to an object that can be used to synchronize DVD commands. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Synchronizing DVD Commands.

Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The ReturnFromSubmenu method returns the display from a submenu to its parent menu.

member.param: Bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration, specifying how to synchronize the command.
Receives a pointer to an object that can be used to synchronize DVD commands. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Synchronizing DVD Commands.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The operation cannot be performed because no GoUp program chain (PGC) is available.

member.name: IDvdControl2.SelectAndActivateButton

Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SelectAndActivateButton method selects and activates the specified menu button.

member.param: Value from 1 through 36 that specifies the button to select and activate.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The ulButton value is valid, but the DVD Navigator filter couldn't activate it.

member.name: IDvdControl2.SelectAngle

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SelectAngle method sets the new angle when the DVD Navigator is in an angle block.

member.param: Value of the new angle, which must be from 1 through 9.
Bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration, specifying how to synchronize the command.
Receives a pointer to an object that can be used to synchronize DVD commands. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Synchronizing DVD Commands.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is in the First Play domain.
The operation cannot be performed at the current playback speed. Set the speed to 1.0.

member.name: IDvdControl2.SelectAtPosition

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SelectAtPosition method highlights the menu button under the mouse pointer position.

member.param: Point on the screen, in screen pixel coordinates.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: No button is present at the mouse pointer position.
The DVD Navigator is in the Stop domain.

member.name: IDvdControl2.SelectAudioStream

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SelectAudioStream method selects the audio stream to play.

member.param: Value that specifies the audio stream. Valid stream numbers are 0 through 7, or DVD_DEFAULT_AUDIO_STREAM to specify the default stream.
Bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration, specifying how to synchronize the command. This parameter is currently ignored; use DVD_CMD_FLAG_None.
Receives a pointer to an object that can be used to synchronize DVD commands. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Synchronizing DVD Commands.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: No default audio stream was found; or dwFlags is not zero.
ulAudio is out of range, or doesn't correspond to an audio stream.
The ulAudio value is valid, but the DVD Navigator could not set it for some reason.

Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SelectButton method selects the specified menu button.

member.param: Value from 1 through 36 that specifies the button to select.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is in an invalid domain.
UOP control prohibits the DVD Navigator from entering a paused state.

Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SelectDefaultAudioLanguage method sets the default audio language.

member.param: Locale identifier that specifies the default language.
enumeration that specifies the default audio language extension.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator filter is not in the Stop domain.

member.name: IDvdControl2.SelectDefaultMenuLanguage

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SelectDefaultMenuLanguage method sets the default language for all menus and menu buttons.

member.param: Variable of type LCID that specifies the default language.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is not in a valid domain.

Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

member.param: Locale identifier that specifies the default language.
enumeration that specifies the default subpicture extension.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator filter is not in a valid domain.

member.name: IDvdControl2.SelectKaraokeAudioPresentationMode

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SelectKaraokeAudioPresentationMode method sends karaoke auxiliary channels to the left or right speakers.

member.param: Bitwise OR of enumeration indicating how to downmix the five karaoke channels to channels 0 and 1, which are usually output to the left and right speakers.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The audio decoder does not support downmixing.
The DVD Navigator filter is in an invalid domain.
UOP control prohibits the current operation.

member.name: IDvdControl2.SelectParentalCountry

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SelectParentalCountry method sets the country/region for interpreting parental access levels and setting default languages.

member.param: Array of bytes that specifies the current country/region according to ISO 3166.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator filter is not in a valid domain.

member.name: IDvdControl2.SelectParentalLevel

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SelectParentalLevel method sets the parental access level for the logged-on user.

member.param: Value that specifies the parental access level for the current user. For details, see Remarks.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

member.name: IDvdControl2.SelectRelativeButton

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SelectRelativeButton method sets the specified relative button (upper, lower, right, or left).

member.param: enumeration value indicating the button to select.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator filter is not in a valid domain.

member.name: IDvdControl2.SelectSubpictureStream

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SelectSubpictureStream method sets the subpicture stream to display.

param.name: ulSubPicture
param.para: Value that specifies the subpicture stream, which must be from 0 through 31, or 63.

listheader.description: The stream is the dummy stream, which means it is a muted, low-bitrate stream.

member.param: Bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration, specifying how to synchronize the command.
Receives a pointer to an object that can be used to synchronize DVD commands. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Synchronizing DVD Commands.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: ulSubPicture is out of range or doesn't correspond to an SP stream.
The ulSubPicture parameter is valid, but DVD Navigator cannot set it for some other reason.

member.name: IDvdControl2.SelectVideoModePreference

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SelectVideoModePreference method sets the specified video mode display (wide screen, letterbox, or pan-scan) for playback.

member.param: Value that specifies the new display mode for DVD content. Member of the enumeration.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

member.name: IDvdControl2.SetDVDDirectory

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetDVDDirectory method sets the DVD drive that the DVD Navigator filter will read from.

member.param: Pointer to a wide-character string that specifies the path of the root directory.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The pszwPath parameter points to an invalid DVD path, or a DVD drive is not found while enumerating.
The DVD Navigator is not initialized.
Invalid domain. For details, see Remarks.

member.name: IDvdControl2.SetGPRM

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetGPRM method sets a general parameter register value.

member.param: Register index; may be a value from zero through 15.
A 16-bit value contained in the specified register.
Bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration, specifying how to synchronize the command.
Receives a pointer to an object that can be used to synchronize DVD commands. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Synchronizing DVD Commands.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The ulIndex parameter is greater than 15 or any other of the input parameters are invalid.

member.name: IDvdControl2.SetState

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetState method saves the current disc position and state of the DVD Navigator filter.

member.param: Pointer to the interface on the object that contains the state information.
Bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration, specifying how to synchronize the command.
Receives a pointer to an object that can be used to synchronize DVD commands. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Synchronizing DVD Commands.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an HRESULT value otherwise.

member.name: IDvdControl2.SetSubpictureState

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetSubpictureState method turns the subpicture display on or off.

member.param: Boolean value that specifies whether the subpicture display is on; TRUE sets subpicture display on for subsequent playback.
Bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration, specifying how to synchronize the command.
Receives a pointer to an object that can be used to synchronize DVD commands. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Synchronizing DVD Commands.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator is in the First Play domain.

member.name: IDvdControl2.ShowMenu

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The ShowMenu method displays the specified menu, if available.

member.param: A enumeration value that specifies the menu to display.
Bitwise OR of one or more flags from the enumeration, specifying how to synchronize the command.
Receives a pointer to an object that can be used to synchronize DVD commands. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Synchronizing DVD Commands.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The specified menu does not exist.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The StillOff method resumes playback, canceling still mode.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The DVD Navigator filter is in a menu domain and the menu has buttons.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The Stop method stops playback of a title or menu by moving the DVD Navigator into the DVD Stop domain.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.
